description:
The column 'id' fro table 'instance_types' in database 'nova' is auto-increased.

MariaDB [nova]> desc instance_types
    -> ;
+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
| Field        | Type         | Null | Key | Default | Extra          |
+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+

| id           | int(11)      | NO   | PRI | NULL    | auto_increment |

+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+

While in the operation 'create flavor', the default value of 'id' is 'auto', which doesn't mean to be 'AUTO_INCREMENT', instead it generate a GUID for it, like '0257d5be-821e-4cdd-ad2c-45139e067aad'.

So the database table design doesn't align with the operation in Horizon. This should be fixed? Thanks.
title: Table column doesn't align with the operation in Horizon

@Zheng Xi, the GUID you saw is not the value of InstanceTypes.id but the value of InstanceTypes.flavorid, see[1].
PS: Now db table 'instance_types' is deprecated and will be removed in later release, please refer to [2].
